Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0.5, read protection not active, only non-secure debug access is possible. Only available when TrustZone is active (TZEN=1)
Level 1, read protection of memories
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the VDD supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset.

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode
No reset generated when entering Stop mode
Reset generated when entering Standby mode
No reset generated when entering Standby mode
SRAM1 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 not erased when a system reset occurs
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
Freeze IWDG counter in stop mode
IWDG counter active in stop mode
Freeze IWDG counter in standby mode
IWDG counter active in standby mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are not swapped
Bank 1 and bank 2 address are swapped
Single bank Flash with contiguous address in bank 1
Dual-bank Flash with contiguous addresses
SRAM2 parity check enable
SRAM2 parity check disable
SRAM2 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 is not erased when a system reset occurs
BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin
nBOOT0 = 0
nBOOT0 = 1

Bit.Name: IO_VDD_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage configuration

Values.Val: High-speed IO at low VDD voltage disabled
High-speed IO at low VDD voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed

Bit.Name: IO_VDDIO2_HSLV
Bit.Description: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage configuration

Values.Val: High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage disabled
High-speed IO at low VDDIO2 voltage enabling in GPIO peripheral allowed
Global TrustZone security disabled
Global TrustZone security enabled

Bit.Name: BOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: The boot is always forced to base address value programmed in SECBOOTADD0

Values.Val: Boot based on the pad/option bit configuration
Boot forced from base address memory

Bit.Name: SECWM1_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of first secure area

Bit.Name: HDP_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of secure hide protection area

Bit.Name: HDPEN
Bit.Description: Secure Hide protection first area enable

Values.Val: No secHDP area
HDP first area is enabled
WRPA start and end pages locked
WRPA start and end pages unlocked
WRPB start and end pages locked
WRPB start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: SECWM2_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Start page of second secure area

Bit.Name: SECWM2_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of second secure area

Bit.Name: HDP2_PEND
Bit.Description: End page of second hide protection area

Values.Val: No HDP area 2
HDP second area is enabled

Bit.Name: WRP2A_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "A" start page

Bit.Name: WRP2A_PEND
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "A" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_2A
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area A unlock

Values.Val: WRP2A start and end pages locked
WRP2A start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: WRP2B_PSTRT
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "B" start page

Bit.Name: WRP2B_PEND
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area "B" end page

Bit.Name: UNLOCK_2B
Bit.Description: Bank 2 WPR first area B unlock

Values.Val: WRP2B start and end pages locked
WRP2B start and end pages unlocked

Bit.Name: KEYDIVERS
Bit.Description: Enable OEM key diversification: the OEM keys are diversified using KDF2 algorithm with OEM key registers and the Device unique authentication ID.The KEYDIVERS should be set to: - 0x0000EABE to diversify the OEM1 key. - 0xEABE0000 to diversify the OEM2 key. - 0xEABEEABE to diversify both keys. - 0x00000000 to diversify none.
